title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Prerequisites: AE21004 3 - 1 - 0: 4 CreditsAnalysis of Aircraft Structures; Thin-walled structures based on elasticity approach; Torsion, bending and shear of open and closed thin-walled cells; Structural instability; Buckling of columns, linear and nonlinear theories, Southwell method, inelastic buckling, buckling under nonconservative forces.Books:T H G Megson, Aircraft Structures for Engineering Students, Edward ArnoldH Ashley, Engineering Analysis of Flight Vehicles, Addison WesleyC K Wang, Introductory Structural Analysis with Matrix Method, Englewood Cliffs, Prentice HallE F Bruhn, Analysis and Design of Aircraft Structures, Tri-State Offset CoE E Sechler and L G Dunn, Airplane Structural Analysis and Design, Dover

title: Concepts taught in class
text: Vibration analysis of Single degree of freedom systems, multi-degree of freedom systems and continuous systems

title: Student Opinion
text: Material provided by the professor is more than sufficient for the course. As a support, he even provides tutorials to practice.

title: Classroom resources
text: NPTEL course on structural dynamics by Prof. P. Banerji would be helpful apart from resourses provided by professor.

title: Additional Resources
text: Prof. Banerji gives a glimpse on earth quake analysis, Building vibration analysis etc. Interested people can proceed using the references given by him.
